intro: Adonis palustris, commonly known as marsh adonis, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils and thrives in marshy or boggy environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. Adonis palustris is often found in association with other wetland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
